title: HCL corp's CEO Roshni Nadar is the richest Indian woman
text:
Next Story : Annu Rani breaks national record in javelin throw

Photo: TwitterAccording to the latest IIFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List, the number of Indians having a net worth of more than Rs 1,000 crore has grown to 953 this year from 831 in 2018; while, the number of billionaires in terms of US dollar have reduced to 138 from 141.There are 82 NRIs on the coveted list of which 76 per cent are self-made. With 31 individuals, USA is the most preferred country for NRIs, followed by the UAE and the UK. The list includes 152 women with an average age of 56 years.Roshni Nadar (37) of HCL technologies is the richest woman with a net worth of Rs 36,800 crore followed by Smita V Crishna (68) of Godrej Group with a net worth of Rs 31,400 crore. With a net worth of Rs 18,500 crore, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw of Biocon retains the crown of the richest self-made woman in India.In this list, 40 per cent of the women derived their wealth from pharmaceuticals, software and services, and FMCG sectors. In fact, pharmaceuticals continue to add the most number of individuals in IIFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List 2019.Interestingly, while the cumulative wealth for this year shows an increase of 2 per cent compared to last year, the average wealth shows a decline of 11 per cent, IFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List said.As many as 344 individuals or more than a third of this year's list witnessed wealth reduction and another 112 could not meet the threshold of Rs 1,000 crore, it added.
description: HCL corp's CEO Roshni Nadar richest Indian woman with a net worth of Rs 36,800 crore according to IIFL Wealth Hurun India Rich List 2019
